lead_paragraph: The Longquan Monastery in northwest Beijing has become a haven for those seeking connectivity instead of seclusion, and practical advice rather than deep philosophy.

byline.contributor: Emily Feng and Owen Guo contributed research.

headline.print_headline: Burned Out in Tech Jobs, and Turning to Buddhism
headline.main: China’s Tech-Savvy, Burned-Out and Spiritually Adrift, Turn to Buddhism

snippet: The Longquan Monastery in northwest Beijing has become a haven for those seeking connectivity instead of seclusion, and practical advice rather than deep philosophy....
abstract: Beijing Journal; Longquan Monastery in northwest Beijing has become haven for type of Buddhism emphasizing practical advice over deep philosophy and urging adherents to embrace connectivity; monastery has drawn new generation of Buddhists, and has drawn praise from state-run media and Chinese officials who promote atheism even as they seek to revive ancient cultural traditions.
